Ebbro 44225 Honda NSX 1997 JGTC Series GT500 Class Test Car

Purchased: 2014
Manufacturer page: http://www.ebbro.jp/SHOP/44225.html

Honda raced the NSX in the JGTC/Super GT series from 1996-2010, winning 2 titles in the GT500 class in 2000 & 2007. Even though the NSX went out of production in 2005 it continued to be used as the works Honda car in the GT500 class until 2010. On October 23, 2009, Honda officially announced the end of the mid-engine NSX's participation in Super GT racing due to new regulations that allowed the use of only front engine, rear drive cars. It was replaced in 2010 with the HSV-010. In yet another example that everything goes in cycles, new 2014 regulations will render the HSV-010 obsolete so Honda's 2014-spec GT500 car is to be based on the - your guessed it - 2015 NSX.

Until Ebbro releases some 2015 NSX models, enjoy what would make a great daily driver Darth Vader.
